title: (x) Looking for ITC Conduit for free
author: crudoman

comments.content: Sorry mate, it's a commercial font - you'll have to buy it.

Hi Hernan. I'm extremely busy these days, but I really   
need new stationary and business cards, and a personal   
website would be nice too. Would you want to design   
those for me? For free?   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20091021113644im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/wink.gif)   
   
Behind every beautiful typeface there is a person.   
Mark van Bronkhurst, who designed ITC Conduit in 1997,   
depends on the sales of his work (the types he designs)   
for an income. I don't think he'd appreciate it if the   
fruit of his labour (and believe me: it takes a _LOT_ of   
time, work and dedication to design a succesful typeface)   
was given away for free, just as you wouldn't like   
it if the logos you design were not paid for.   
   
I don't want to sound preachy, but this is the third   
request for font piracy in a week on "our" board,   
and I don't think I really like this evolution. It's   
like going to a jewelers' convention and ask where   
you could steal some jewelry. Get the picture?   
 ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20091021113644im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

Yves, I check out the forums at My Fonts and you would not believe how many people get angry they have to pay for a font. As my local public radio station (WBGO) during a fund drive says, when you leave the grocery store you can't just say to the casheer that the guy behind me will pay for my groceries. It amazes me! Bither way, less than 1% of listeners to my public radio station are members. Dan

It's the first time I try the 'person behind the face'   
approach. I hope they will understand better when they   
realize they're ripping off some guy, a designer like   
themselves, not just a faceless company.

Yves, I see your approach, my public radio station is one of the few remaining Jazz radio stations in the USA. They have a website with streaming for listeners from throughout the world. I love that station. But the point is If I love a design in type I'm happy to support the artist that created it. I bought Dalliance because of its beauty (to me), and I'm thinking of buying Tarzana as well. Dan
Yves, I've got a new name for Type Idenification board, just add "no free lunch"

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20091021113644im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/lol.gif)   
   
Actually, I'm trying to come up with something constructive   
that addresses this 'problem'. Gimme a couple of days.
Tangent: I miss WBGO. Public radio up here just isn't the same. I'm not as big of a fan of WGBH.

Colin listen to WBGO online, they have it streaming online. Its wbgo.org. But wait until October 1 because they are in the last days of fund raising and they get really desperate near the end. I wish most of the listeners were like me and gave re-uped the first hour of the first day. I really enjoy the Blues hour. Dan

At least he asked politely! I am totally with Yves - good post. There are folks posting these same questions to MyFonts.com all the time. I work at a place that sells typefaces and we often get that response: "HOW much!!??" like it's a big shock when you tell them the cost. I think people (especially those of a certain age brought up on the wonders of the internet) expect a free ride too often. The trouble is, they will probably find Conduit for free on some dodgy freeware site. ![:-(](http://web.archive.org/web/20091021113644im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/sad.gif)

I think something that adds to the problem are these "free font" sites who make it look like \*all\* fonts on their site are free and then try to add the charge last minute. Very misleading and sure to upset potential customers.

Some people say I'm an idiot for having assembled a   
library of 600+ music CDs with only one illegal copy.   
:/
Jill - You have a point. There will be an article on that very topic on _Typographica_ very soon.

Paul do you work for MyFonts? If you do your Internet Provider is killing the Forums. 3/4 of the time now there is no posting just an error message. I like the forums because I learn things by exchanging ideas, but MyFonts forums are unusable right now. Dan

Daniel, the MyFonts Webmaster seems to have   
 gotten things fixed in the last couple of days.   
 Try again.
